text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Scientists analyse effects of global warming, atmospheric ozone on crops
text.summary: In a study published on July 27, 2014 in the journal Nature Climate Change, scientists have forecast a substantial reduction of wheat, rice, maize and soybean crop yields by 2050 due to climate change and ozone pollution, leading to global undernourishment levels of 27â€“49%.
